column2: Invitations have gone out to your vassals asking them to join you in this spring's Sarapia festival. You have decided to make the festival this year a special one, remembered by both gods and men for many years to come.
Let us begin preparations.
Invitation to the Sarapia festival is sent.
[From.GetTitledFirstName], your liege, has invited you to join [From.GetHerHim] for this winter's Sarapia festival. There you will pay tribute and honor the great deity Serapis.
I will be there.
I will have nothing to do with that nonsense!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has declined your invitation to attend the Sarapia festival! Apparently [From.GetSheHe] has no faith in Serapis, Isis  and the other gods, and instead follows the strange rituals of some other religion that is foreign to our ways.
A foolish mistake.
Your vassals have arrived and the time of the Sarapia festival is upon us. Its time to go to the temple for the start of the ceremony.
We honor you, Serapis.
At last, the time of the Sarapia festival is upon us. Its time to go to the temple for the start of the ceremony.
With the sacrifices being completed, you and your vassals gather for the great feast your servants have prepared!
Let us drink together!
With the sacrifices being completed, you gather together with your liege and the rest of [From.GetHerHis] vassals for the great feast [From.GetSheHe] has prepared!
The Sarapia festival has concluded. Your vassals are returning home, but most seem to agree that the Sarapia festival was well worth the trip.
Until next time!
Beginning of Sacrifices and Offerings
Everyone has been gathered into the temple complex for the start of the ceremony as the priests finish up preparing for its start.
Hopefully this goes well
Wine Libations
As the ceremony begins you start by pouring wine as a libation or offering to the deity Serapis with the hopes of receiving his blessings
Hail Serapis
Sacrifice of Pigs and Cows
Now that the wine has been offered its time for the animal sacrifices, should I sacrifice a pig or cow?
A pig
A cow
Purification Acts
Now that the sacrifices have been completed the priests of Serapis perform a cleansing ritual on you as others prepare for the next and final part of the ceremony
Great
Masked Procession
What a enjoyable and satisfying time
Celebrate the Isia Festival

The Mourning of Isis
The first stage of the festival involves a Symbolic Re-enactment of Isis mourning Osris, culminating in the discovery of pieces
A touching re-enactment
Procession of the Gilded Cow
As the re-enactment comes to a conclusion the priests begin a procession to take a Gilded Cow to the temple
Praise Isis
The Ending of the Ritual Ceremony
As the procession ends the priests begin the ending phase of the ritual ceremony by pouring water over earth representing rebirth and life
The ceremony has concluded and the feast should begin soon
